alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued May 20 at 10:06AM EDT until May 20 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...In Maryland, the Atlantic coast of Worcester County. In North Carolina, the Atlantic coast of Eastern Currituck County. In Virginia, Virginia Beach...and the Atlantic coast of Accomack and Northampton Counties. * WHEN...From 8 AM EDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The most likely time for strong rip currents to occur is a couple hours either side of low tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour.
